title: Anup Jalota, Atal's ex-media adviser now on PB board
text:
NEW DELHI: Media adviser to former PM Atal Bihari Vajpayee, Ashok Tandon, singer Anup Jalota and former Britannia chief Sunil Alagh are among the four persons who are set to become part-time members of the Prasar Bharati Board.
Besides Tandon and Jalota, the name of Shashi Shekhar, who headed an online media company, have been cleared by a three-member committee headed by Vice President M Hamid Ansari sources said.
"There were four vacant positions of part-time members in Prasar Bharti Board, I&B ministry had prepared a panel of around a dozen eminent names from which four persons have been chosen by the committee," sources said.
The I&B ministry had earlier forwarded a list of a dozen names including that of Bollywood actor Kajol, former editor of 'Organiser' Seshadri Chari among others.
A three-member panel headed by Vice President M Hamid Ansari and comprising Press Council of India (PCI) chairman Justice (retd) C K Prasad and I&B secretary Sunil Arora is learnt to have approved the four names at a meeting last evening.
As per the Prasar Bharati Act, the public broadcaster should have six-part time members on its Board which is headed by its chairman.
